BodyName: Committee on Civil Service and Labor

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass S.5456-A/A.8420-A, also known as “The Employee’s Mail Order Pharmacy Bill of Rights”, legislation which would prohibit any health insurance policy from imposing an additional fee or co-pay requirement on any employee or insured person who elects to purchase prescribed drugs from a pharmacy source other than a mail order provider.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: The Employee’s Mail Order Pharmacy Bill of Rights

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, the administrative code of the city of New York and local law number 58 for the year 1996, relating to performance by the police department of certain functions previously performed by the department of transportation, in relation to authorizing employees of the police department to perform parking enforcement functions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Performance by the police department of certain functions previously performed by the Dept of Transportation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, the administrative code of the city of New York and local law number 58 for the year 1996, relating to performance by the police department of certain functions previously performed by the department of transportation, in relation to authorizing employees of the police department to perform parking enforcement functions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Performance by the police department of certain functions previously performed by the Dept of Transportation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, the administrative code of the city of New York and local law number 58 for the year 1996, relating to performance by the police department of certain functions previously performed by the department of transportation, in relation to authorizing employees of the police department to perform parking enforcement functions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
